item.title: Dropdown Usability Research Shows They Mostly Suck
item.description:
Baymard Institute’s usability research confirms what many of us suspected: dropdowns are problematic in most contexts. They work well only in very specific, limited circumstances.

The research shows users struggle with dropdowns for various reasons - from poor mobile experiences to cognitive load issues when scanning long lists.
